page.title: 12Our Pocket Money
page.content: Most children in Bridge Farm Infant school have pocket money.Pocket money is given to children by their parents each week.They can choose how to spend it or they can save it.Most children in this school start to have pocket money when they are six years old. The amounts vary between 20p and Â£1.It usually starts as a small sum and rises as the children get older. The children who spend their money buy sweets,comics,magazines,ice lollies and fruit at local shops. The children who save their money put it in a bank,a building society,or a post office saving account. Some children save up to buy presents for special occasions such as birthdays or Christmas.Pocket money is also often saved up to spend whilst on holiday.
